definition: to have never met sb before (idiom); entirely unacquainted/a complete stranger/not to know sb from Adam
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: When travelling, she preferred anonymous company.
sentences.chinese: 她喜歡同素昧平生的伴侶旅行。

sentences.english: Usually, people will reach out and connect with colleagues whom they have never met or talked to before.
sentences.chinese: 通常，人們會設法和他們素昧平生的同事聯繫。

sentences.english: Gifts poured in not only from unknown people.
sentences.chinese: 不但素昧平生的人寄來了大量的禮物。

sentences.english: I have never made his acquaintance.; I don't know him at all.

definition: lit. neither a relative nor a friend (idiom)/fig. unrelated to one another in any way
as close as one's hands and feet (idiom); loving one another as brothers/deep friendship/closely attached to one another
a benefactor/a person who has significantly helped sb else
to get to know each other/acquaintance
to be kindred spirits/to hit it off
